column2:
noun
  1. test; tool used for confirming a pregnancy or an infection

noun
  1. a wild sage, perhaps Salvia aethiopis, Salvia nilotica, or Salvia schimperi

verb
  1. to be near, to be close, to approach

verb
  1. to be infected, to be afflicted (with a sickness)

verb
  1. to be divided
  2. to share with each other

noun
  1. body; the physical part of a creature (as opposed to the soul)

pron
  1. she (third-person singular feminine polite personal subject pronoun)

pron
  1. you (second-person singular masculine polite personal subject pronoun)

pron
  1. you (second-person singular feminine polite personal subject pronoun)

pron
  1. he (third-person singular masculine polite personal subject pronoun)

verb
  1. to vaccinate
  2. to draft, to enlist
  3. to make amulets

prep
  1. from (used to indicate origin or source)
  2. from (used to indicate the start of a time or range)
  3. of (used to indicate membership to a group or category)

noun
  1. amulet
  2. fetish, charm, a strip or ribbon into which one scribbles indecipherable text to ward off evil

noun
  1. lance, javelin, shorter or generic spear
  2. (figuratively) soldiers, army

adj
  1. noble, honorable, respected (of a person)
  2. expensive, valuable, precious

noun
  1. African bowstring hemp (Sanseviera guineensis syn. Sansevieria hyacinthoides)

verb
  1. to move (to a new home), to relocate

noun
  1. ear of a plant like corn or sorghum

verb
  1. to weed, to take out the weeds

noun
  1. African pencil cedar (Juniperus procera)
  2. modernly reused to translate the Western concept of a Christmas tree and fir, which does not occur in Africa south of the 30th parallel north
